website_summaries.verdict: Ladies, this is a good option if you are looking for a vest that is specifically designed for the female shape; but it may not work if you need to carry numerous items for your walk or run.
pros: Features a trim, comfortable fit that's structured for women's bodies
Breathable mesh and lightweight construction make is a good choice for runners
Can fit up to 2 liters of water
cons: The pockets aren't very spacious, and some owners wish it had more
Straps tend to need adjusting or tightening with rigorous activity

customer_reviews.title: But really a fabulous well made sturdy product for being so lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Its heavier than I expected to run with one of these but it's been critical in Virginia humidity! It slows me down a bit until it's about half full, worked perfectly for my first ultra marathon (50k) no chafing, pockets could have a bit more storage space because it's hard to access everything you need in the back, so that back pocket is just kindof my emergency essentials for me, because who wants to unload the pack during a run? But really a fabulous well made sturdy product for being so lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: N. R. Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: A must for marathon training
customer_reviews.text: For me the price of this hydration vest has been worth it. I used it all last year through marathon training and the race itself, but is still looks brand new. Lately I put it on anytime I run outside regardless of distance because it is the most comfortable way to hold my phone. I keep my gummy bears (instead of gels) in the other front pocket. In the back pocket, separate from the water pocket, I keep an emergency poncho and cash. I also like the way the water bag opens as compared to my husband’s camelback.
customer_reviews.author: R. Roe

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, lots of storage, no rubbing under swinging arms
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased 3 different running vests for my wife to try for her training, and this is the one she kept. The issue with the others was the straps, buckles or seams rubbing under the arm (e.g. the Camelback was the worst). The lighter weight Nathan had an attachment strap that wanted to run directly across her breasts, which was irritating. This one, while a little more bulky, was perfect for her. There are lots of storage compartments, including one that fits her iphone 7+. Her nathan handheld fits comfortably as well, so she can carry an electrolyte in addition to the water in the vest. Overall, 5 starts for comfort and function.
customer_reviews.author: Mike. R

customer_reviews.title: Made for women - no bounce running hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: After searching for weeks for a women’s hydration pack I finally decided on this one. It was the best choice I could have made. It fits to a women’s shape, does NOT bounce - even with the bladder only partially filled. I used it for the first time today and was skeptical that I would like it. I LOVE it. I purposely only partially filled the bladder, no leaks, no bounce, easy to drink from and super easy to fill/remove and let dry. I could not be happier with the Nathan brand.
customer_reviews.author: Carr

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!! No rubbing! No bouncing!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t wait for my run to try this hydration vest! Did my research on Runner’s World and asked my running peers for brand advice. Nathan consistenly was recommended. Wore it today for a quick 4-mile speed run and... intentionally only filled the bladder half way to see if there would be any ‘bounce’ and there was none! Having a vest instead of a backpack placed the little bit of water weight between my shoulders and not my lower back. Had no rubbing. The front pocket fit my iPhone 10 without issue. Im extremely happy and excited to wear it for my longer runs!!
customer_reviews.author: Madelyn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 1 Clip Vest
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with my long runs in the heat this summer. I wanted a 2 liter vest with 1 clip in the front that had pockets. This was the greatest investment I have made all summer. I can fit a Nuun bottle in the front along with salt chews and energy snacks. I do not run with my phone, but most likely it would not fit in the zippered pocket. You would need to store it in the open pocket. It is easy to clean, and I have never had it rub my skin at all during a run.
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: No bounce!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like running with hydration packs but because of the hot weather this summer, I decided to purchase one for my long Sunday runs. It was important to me that it stayed in place and didn't bounce and it did just that! It made a world of difference and I used electrolyte tabs instead of plain water. The pockets are great for cliff blocks and my phone. It was easy to clean; just remember to have it in the lock position before cleaning it otherwise you'll have a mess.
customer_reviews.author: A. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Thought, Creativity and Engineering in a Lightweight Vest.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I started running outside because our respective gyms temporarily closed. In the past, I had used a waist belt for my water, but this has always felt uncomfortable and difficult to manage while running. She has been running long distances for many years and recommended the Nathan Hydration Running Vest. Perfect for me! Lightweight with well -thought out pockets, straps and loops, plus a ‘“hands-free” hydration tube! I don’t have to worry about dropping my water bottle (I have) or struggling to force it back into the belt holder. What a superb piece of engineering. It is worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Patti Yamamoto

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pack!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hydration pack! 2 liter bladder with a light/comfy fit is hard to beat. I will continue to suggest it to every runner I know. Takes a few excursions to get the adjustments just right and to get the plastic taste from the hose/bag. That’s expected though! I’m currently training for a marathon, I use this pack 2-3 times a week and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Shantel G. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten it sooner
customer_reviews.text: With all races in my area gone virtual, I had to bring my own water. I wasn't sure about making the investment, but it was totally worth it. I have room in the front for my phone, there's no sloshing and it's very adjustable. I had not issues with rubbing and even with 2L of water, it was distributed well!
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long runs
customer_reviews.text: Used this pack to run the Washington DC Army Ten Miler and it was AMAZING! Little to no movement or shifting while running and approved by race regulations.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vest hydration pack! It has plenty of was, my keys, my phone, my gu... Everything that I need fory.long run or a long hike without josseling around. This pack is really comfortable. Last Saturday, while I was on a.long run, I crossed paths with two other ladies wearing the same pack. We all agreed that we wouldn't want to live without it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Mae

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this vest because I am increasing my mileage and need to carry more water for myself and my four legged friend. It took a little while to figure out how to release the buckle and get it on. I ended up returning it because there was only one buckle in the front and I couldn’t quite get it to be comfortable. Also there weren’t enough pockets. It was well made it just didn’t work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Conway

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I used the vest for the first time on a 16 mile run. I filled the bladder with ice and water to full capacity, no leaks while running. Only problem was the bite valve did not stay in place, when not in use. I had to tuck it in under the front strap, because it would bounce around if I did not. The front zipper pocket did not hold my smartphone, but I placed it in the back zipper pocket which worked fine. The front pockets held gels and chews. Didn't feel awkward or heavy at all while running despite the 70 degree temp and high humidity. Overall all a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: fkelley

customer_reviews.title: Bladder leak!
customer_reviews.text: I love the vest itself but was very disappointed when the bladder leaked as soon as i put water in the first time... Seriously heartbroken i spent the $ for this awesome vest and i can't even use it! I hope there is a way i can return the bladder and keep the vest. I think i should be sent a new bladder as well free of charge. This is going to set back my marathon training.... Just dumbfounded really...

customer_reviews.title: The water bladder leaks
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of this pack, and it’s really convenient to hold my gels! Unfortunately, the water bladder leaks and cold water trickles down my back while I’m running. I’ve tried filling it up below the fill point but that doesn’t seem to help. I won’t be recommending this pack to my friends :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this hydration pack.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I'm tall and broad shouldered so I was concerned about the fit. Very adjustable! My Galaxy S7 fits in the right side pocket just fine and sunglasses in the other. The hydration bag is designed extremely well. Very easy to clean and fill. Bite release mouthpiece makes it so easy to use hands free during any run. Great product! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: carol barr

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. It doesn't bounce around so I like that but the side straps bug my arms after 50 miles on my horse. I am still shopping for the perfect hydro pack. Color is nice. I will probably sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Sally T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to drink from
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and super easy to drink from the valve. Made my longrun easier...took less energy to drink from the tube than to pull a soft flask out of my old waistpack. I wish it had 2 pockets for flasks in the front though, but they sell a different vest that does that.
customer_reviews.author: BikeTrainRun

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight- easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I liked it a lot, but I have sensitive skin and found it changed quite badly for just a 10 mile run. I would probably only wear it with a tee underneath (I was wearing crop tops both times I wore it. My friend who has the same one and wore the same crop top had no chafing.
customer_reviews.author: Dash

customer_reviews.title: holds all my crap and is comfy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nathan running pack and I won't ever try another brand. No bounce, adjustable, holds all my crap and is comfy. Win!
customer_reviews.author: L. BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Nathan Hydration vest! The first one lasted many years and many many miles. It finally started to fall apart and I was excited to buy a new version of the exact same thing. It has many points of adjustment for various size athletes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: 1. It is light weight. 2. Did not move while I was running 3. The phone pocket is the right size for my iPhone 11 Pro Max 4. Holds my keys and nutrition without an issue I am so glad I purchased this backpack for running long distances.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is my new running buddy, and it’s lightweight, holds my phone, water, snacks, spare shirt, and doesn’t move around while running. A great purchase, highly recommend! Straps are more comfortable at the bra line.
customer_reviews.author: Mayurah

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: It may have worked out better for me if there were 2 straps in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable than I'd expected
customer_reviews.text: Much more comfortable than I'd expected. The clasp at the front needed readjustment at the beginning of my run, but it was my first time using it, and I figured it out, and completed a 10 miler with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Love this vest!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration vest! I does not bounce or chafe, holds a ton of hydration, is easy to clean and has ample storage for my phone, Gu, gloves, etc. I’m so happy I bough it! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BeccaC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It’s my second one- my hubby took my first one ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: You hardly feel like you are wearing it. Does cause chafing. Lots of room for gels and extras.
customer_reviews.author: ericka alm

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 would recommend This it’s absolutely amazing! I will say I thought it was a little bit bigger size but once it’s actually on your back it fits like a glove stays in place when running, biking and hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great for trail running!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a trail race. Fits perfectly with lots of places to adjust, holds a full water bladder, rain jacket, and socks along with some snack in the back and my phone (6s Plus) in the front pocket. No chafing that I noticed!
customer_reviews.author: sallysagator2

customer_reviews.title: Very handy comfortable pack
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic for hiking. I do wish one pocket was slightly larger for iPhones. Barely fits in and isn’t very secure. I am able to carry my ID,snacks, and small first aid kit.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight product
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight Nathan water backpack was great for my second half marathon. Comfortable straps, just enough water to carry and plenty of pockets to store my phone and protein bar.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this pack
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pack! Didn't realise that it wasn't made from the expandable material on purchase however still serves all of my needs and more. Plus the colour is fantastic! Thank you Nathan for making such beautiful and practical packs!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hinde

customer_reviews.title: Bite valve
customer_reviews.text: Bite valve got a hole fairly quickly and I can't find replacement valve.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration vest
customer_reviews.text: This hydration vest is great!! Light weight and stays in place. I ran 14 miles the first time I used the vest and I love it. A must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn J.

customer_reviews.title: Bladder damaged easily
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration pack, but I had it less than a month and the bladder got a pinhole leak!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best pack I've used for running. Stays firmly on your back without jostling.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love my pack!!! I have used it for many long runs and it has not disappointed me once!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Johnson

product_meta.title: Nathan Hydration Running Vest with 2 Liter Bladder Included. Back Pack with Drinking Bite Valve - Smartphone Compatible Pocket for Storing Essentials - Blue
product_meta.description: This iconic female- friendly featherweight hydration vest comes with a light and breathable perforated back panel. Stash pocket over left front fits several gels. Rear external shock cord for increase capacity. Internal rear stash pocket and key ring clip. Easy on/off with full side adjustability. Weighs 14.4oz. One size fits most and adjustable.
feature_bullets: HYDRATION THAT LASTS - Stores an entire 2 Liters of water to keep you hydrated throughout your workout, designed with bite valve
ONE SIZE FITS MOST- Adjustable chest straps to fit a wide range of sizes, fully adjustable to suit your body and comfort
PATENTED 3-WAY HARNESS - Evenly distributes the weight of liquids and belongings for a bounce-free ride while you run, hike, marathon, or bike
SMART-PHONE COMPATIBLE - Includes a front water bottle pocket and front zip smartphone pocket to store your phone, nutrition, and any essentials you need
HIGHLY BREATHABLE - Straps are designed with lightweight, breathable mesh, stays snug throughout your run, doesn’t chafe or rub

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
